data.title: Paul Reade
data.meta_description: Paul Geoffrey Reade was an English composer. Born in Liverpool, he studied piano and composition (1962-1965) at the Royal Academy of Music with Alan Richardson and worked at English National Opera as a répétiteur. In 1991 he received an Ivor Novello Award for his theme music for The Victorian Kitchen Garden television series.
data.text:
Not to be confused with Paul Read.

Paul Geoffrey Reade (10 January 1943 – 7 June 1997) was an English composer. Born in Liverpool, he studied piano and composition (1962-1965) at the Royal Academy of Music with Alan Richardson and worked at English National Opera as a répétiteur.[1] In 1991 he received an Ivor Novello Award for his theme music for The Victorian Kitchen Garden television series.[2]
